title: Bug 102436 - Date/time value not stored correctly in report design
description: An invalid date/time string (which does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format) should have been rejected.
OB:
When a new 'DateTime' type report parameter is created in BIRT report designer, and an invalid date string (e.g., '55/66/9999') is entered as the default value, the invalid value is accepted and the following definition shows up in the report design:

<parameters><scalarparameter name='dateParam1'><property name='dataType'>dateTime</property><property name='allowBlank'>false</property><property name='format'>Unformatted</property><property name='controlType'>textbox</property><expression name='defaultValue'>55/66/9999</expression></scalarparameter></parameters>

Two problems here:

(1) The model should have stored a 'dateTime' type constant using the XML schema date/time format ('yyyymmddThh:mm:ss', see http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema2/), which is locale independent, to ensure portability.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:

1. Open BIRT report designer.
2. Create a new report parameter of type 'DateTime'.
3. In the 'default value' field, enter an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999'.
4. Observe that the invalid value is accepted and the parameter definition appears as mentioned in the description.
